title: Bug 116786 - Library include should store relative path
OB: When reviewing the report design, I noticed that the library include section stores the absolute path of the library file. This creates issues when the report design is moved to a different location. For example, in the property section, the fileName property shows an absolute path: <property name="fileName" value="E:/birt/sampleReports/otherlib/lib1.rptlibrary"/>. Additionally, the namespace property is also missing the relative path information.
EB:
Expected Behavior:
1. When a library is included in a report design, the BIRT designer should automatically generate the relative path for the library file.
2. The relative path should be saved in the report design, instead of the absolute path.
Example: If my report design is located at $project/test, the relative path for the library file should be saved as $project/test/otherlib/lib1.rptlibrary
SR:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the BIRT designer.
2. Create a new report design or open an existing one.
3. Include a library in the report design.
4. Check the property section of the library include to see if the fileName property contains an absolute path instead of a relative path.
5. Also, verify if the namespace property is missing the relative path information.
